definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create

sentences.english: As has been the case before, the military can be a trailblazer for the private sector.
sentences.chinese: 跟以往一样，美军可为私营企业开创道路。
这是一个开创性的时刻，周一。

sentences.english: We ought to preserve this ancient art with modern aesthetic consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 要以现代审美意识开创经典。

sentences.english: "Tan Yi Lu, " is a ground-breaking comparison of Chinese and Western poetics.
sentences.chinese: 《谈艺录》是一部具有开创性的中西比较诗论。

sentences.english: "Vino Nobile" is the starter series into the world of beverage-specific glasses.
sentences.chinese: “诺柏酒杯”开创了世界上饮料特效杯的新纪元。

sentences.english: We are willing to cooperate with both new and old customers to create a beautiful tomorrow in common!
sentences.chinese: 愿与新老客户精诚合作，为开创碧水蓝天共同努力。

sentences.english: With excitement and enthusiasm we started our small business.
sentences.chinese: 带着兴奋和热情，我们开创了我们的事业。

sentences.english: The government also initiated a public-works scheme that is mopping up over 2% of the labour force.
sentences.chinese: 政府还开创了公共劳动计划，吸收了2%的劳动力。

sentences.english: Create a "XX Music Channel V" precedent, a minor celebrity at school.
sentences.chinese: 开创“XX音乐榜中榜”先例，在校内小有名气。

sentences.english: I'm intrigued by the life you've created here.
sentences.chinese: 我对你们在这里所开创的生活很好奇。

sentences.english: It was said that the writer of Journey to the West was Qiu Chuji the originator of Quanzhen denomination.
sentences.chinese: 古传《西游记》是全真教龙门派开创者丘处机所撰。

sentences.english: It predicts a ground breaking year. And we are not even half way through.
sentences.chinese: 这预示着开创性的一年。我们呢？

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅与胡适是新文学的开创者与奠基人。

sentences.english: Descent: Freespace is a new chapter in space dogfight sims.
sentences.chinese: 《纵横太空》开创了太空格斗模拟游戏的新篇章。

sentences.english: And to think we once thought spray-on bandages were revolutionary.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾认为喷涂绷带是开创性医疗技术。

sentences.english: It has now pioneered a method to turn cornfield debris into glycols.
sentences.chinese: 现在开创的新方法是把玉米田中的剩余物变成乙二醇。

definition: priority/sth advocated first/refers to ancient tradition: Worship the river first, then the sea.
to create/original creation/to be the first to do sth
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to open up/to set up/to establish
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
accomplishment/success/achievement/CL:個|个[ge4]/to achieve (a result)/to create/to bring about
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
